article.headline: Hofstra 80, UNC Wilmington 69 2OT
article.story: WILMINGTON, N.C. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored 26 points and Antoine Agudio added 23 as Hofstra outlasted UNC Wilmington 80-69 in double overtime Wednesday. With the game tied at 61-61 at the end of regulation, each team scored only four points apiece in the first overtime, leading to a second that ended just before midnight. The Pride took control in the second overtime, gaining an 11-point lead -- the largest gap of the game -- and outscoring the Seahawks (3-8, 0-2 Colonial Athletic Association) 15-4. Stokes grabbed 10 rebounds and Carlos Rivera chipped in 16 points for Hofstra (9-4, 2-0 CAA). The Pride sealed the win by making 5-of-6 free throws in the final minute. The Seahawks took an early lead and led 34-31 at halftime. Daniel Fountain and Vladimir Kuljanin came off the bench to lead UNC Wilmington with 16 points apiece. Jeff Horowitz added 14, and Temi Soyebo had 10. Soyebo's layup with 30 seconds left in regulation set up the first overtime putting the score at 61-61, with Hofstra's Stokes missing on a floater in the lane with one and a half seconds to go.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
